did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Teaching materials for history of printing and the book,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: An artificial collection assembled through time by the Department of Special Collections of objects, manuscripts, and printing samples relating to the development of printing and book making.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: The Media materials require at least two weeks advance notice to use in order to allow staff time to have use copies made from the original items.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Teaching materials for history of printing and the book. M0931. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquisition information varies, but most printing samples (boxes 2 & 3) are from Margaret Sowers, 1996.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Provenance various, but most printing samples (boxes 2 & 3) are from Margaret Sowers, 1996.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Printing
Books-History.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection are uncatalogued. These materials demonstrate the art and development of printing and book making. The list includes items in four boxes. There is also a list of relevant items from other collections that can be paged from Special Collections stacks.

did.unittitle: A front and back board, matching, with leather exterior and embroidered interior.
Seal - "Sigillvm Prepositi Societatis"
did.physdesc: Imprint on leather in envelope of tooling examples.

did.unittitle: VHS Video: "The Art of bookbinding" by Gerard Charriere

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: The Media materials require at least two weeks advance notice to use in order to allow staff time to have use copies made from the original items.
